text:
Hello,

I scanned my website with the SEO tool now I get back 3500 recommendations but when I use lighthouse the site is 91% performance 86% best practice 92% accesability and 92% seo

Now I get 500 errors from it saying "Reduce how long the page is blocked from responding to user input"

But lighthouse says my tbt = 0ms

How can I fix this? and is the SEO tool always accurate?
On our side we’re using gatsby.js to generate static blog
And we get the source via HubSpot API
And we’re currently working on a source to get content of your modules used in the website but still a poc
Is there a link you could share?
Well its on the backend of the HubSpot website I can only share screens

Hello! Where are you trying to change the font? I'm assuming that you are using a theme, which should have the ability to select a primary and secondary font. Those would use Google Fonts. Then those fonts would be used throughout the theme. HOWEVER, if you are trying to change the font in a Rich Text module, that will NOT pull from the theme and will just give you a small list of stock font options. I do have some themes in the Marketplace where I include a custom rich text module that allows you to pull your theme fonts in. Otherwise, even in a rich text module, your text should pull the font family that you set in your theme unless you override it.

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Is it mostly on blog posts?
that happened once to me while I had my own custom schema markup on the page

It was the internal blog search.  I submitted a second support ticket and that tech was able to re-index the search for me.  I figured that’s all that I needed done but the first tech kept telling me it was a google issue :/
i have the same issue with a site and no luck to solve :disappointed:
